attributes.action: abandon the proposed scrapping of empty rates relief on business premises
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Budget proposals will restrict regeneration (as speculative development stalls and buildings are deconstructed to avoid tax), cause hardship to tenants locked into leases with restrictive subletting provisions, cause a decline in capital values (affecting pension funds already very hard hit under previous budgets) and drive business overseas where property taxes are much lower.  The newly launched Code for Leasing Business Premises may well be compromised as landlords become reluctant to vary terms which ensure that the burden of empty rates costs falls on tenants.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "abandon the proposed scrapping of empty rates relief on business premises."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
